channel.title: Changing keyboard speed and swaping keys
channel.description: Before I did it on the gui, but on the new wayland version of kicksecure, I ca’t seem to figure out how to chamge the keyboard delay and repeat speed. Please can someone share how, thanks. I also need to swap caps and escape.

item.title: Changing keyboard speed and swaping keys
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
KWin is not supported on Kicksecure 18. See a recent forum thread:

Kde doesn't work correctly with Kicksecure 18 Support
Hi guys, active kicksecure user since more than 2 years. First of all thank you very much for all the job you do for support privacy, security and especially, for FOSS. Basically my post is just for communicate and put on record in the forum, that for me, has been impossible to configure and run smoothly kde plasma 6 in kicksecure 18. I know has been some discussion about which desktop environment would be better for the security standards and that kde is not the best. But I like it. I have …

You can configure additional workspaces in labwc, which can be switched between using a keyboard shortcut. See:

labwc.github.io

labwc

An Openbox inspired wlroots-based stacking Wayland compositor.

Unfortunately, LXQt’s desktop switcher widget does not work with labwc yet. It probably will in Kicksecure 19, but this is the best solution for the time being (unless we create a custom desktop switcher widget of our own sooner than that).

Read full topic
item.source: Changing keyboard speed and swaping keys

item.title: Changing keyboard speed and swaping keys
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
You can configure this in labwc. There isn’t a GUI option for configuring this at the moment, but you can configure it in ~/.config/labwc/rc.xml. See:

labwc.github.io

labwc

An Openbox inspired wlroots-based stacking Wayland compositor.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing keyboard speed and swaping keys
